docs.snippet: Marketers are increasingly concerned that too many of the influencers they pay to push their products are actually followed by a percentage of accounts that are fake.

headline.print_headline: Marketers At Last Reckon With the Bots
headline.main: Uncovering Instagram Bots With a New Kind of Detective Work

docs.snippet: Hannah Reyes Morales photographed scenes of death in Manila during the anti-drug campaign. She later returned to those sites to capture the daily lives of residents living in the midst of violence.

headline.print_headline: Finding Tenderness in Communities Affected by Manila’s Anti-Drug Killings
headline.main: Finding Tenderness in Communities Affected by Manila’s Anti-Drug Killings

docs.snippet: Posters at some American and overseas universities are opposing plans to erase term limits for China’s president, a rare show of protest among Chinese students.

headline.print_headline: Some Chinese Students Protest Xi’s Control Move
headline.main: Far From Home and Censors, Some Chinese Students Protest Xi’s Power Move

docs.snippet: Satellite images and a drone discovered about 1.5 million Adélie penguins living in the Danger Islands, one of two species whose habitats require ice.

headline.print_headline: A Supercolony of Penguins Has Been Found Near Antarctica
headline.main: A Supercolony of Penguins Has Been Found Near Antarctica

docs.snippet: The deaths of two children crossing a busy street in Brooklyn suggest that the war on pedestrian fatalities is really a war against unfit motorists.

headline.print_headline: Reckless Driving and the Limits of Vision Zero
headline.main: Reckless Driving and the Limits of Vision Zero

docs.snippet: When Campbell Robertson set out to find why black worshipers were leaving white-majority churches, he recalled the little Baptist church he grew up in.

headline.print_headline: At the Crossroads of Church and Race, a Reporter Glimpses His Childhood
headline.main: At the Crossroads of Church and Race, a Reporter Glimpses His Childhood

docs.snippet: A rewrite suggestion from an official in the country’s Family Ministry has drawn a backlash. But other countries have carried through with similar changes.

headline.print_headline: No More ‘Fatherland’? Germans Take Up the Debate
headline.main: No More ‘Fatherland’? Germans Debate Gender-Neutral Anthem

docs.snippet: Trump promised again and again to hire the “best people.” That didn’t happen.
The cocktail world is rediscovering a juice that was largely sidelined to the tiki bar.

headline.print_headline: Pineapple, a Spiky Outsider, Is Now a Regular at the Bar
headline.main: Pineapple, a Spiky Outsider, Is Now a Regular at the Bar

docs.snippet: Under a deal reached Tuesday, lawmakers enacted 5 percent raises for all state workers. Union leaders said it was enough to get the teachers back to work after almost two weeks.

headline.print_headline: West Virginia’s Teachers Get Pay Raise to End Statewide Strike
headline.main: West Virginia Raises Teachers’ Pay to End Statewide Strike
